text: Hi everyone - The agency I am working for is looking for freelancers to collaborate on a regular basis in 2019. If anyone is interested, please PM me and I'll provide you with further details. Thank you :slightly_smiling_face:

Not a freelancer, but Spin Group is a HubSpot Certified development company, we partner with marketing agencies to build HubSpot, WordPress, Shopify and full custom websites. We work with your existing project management tools, can white-label, and provide ongoing support to sites we build/inherit. We exist to let you guys do the kind of work YOU want to do, and off load the dev and technical side of it to us.

<@U7X5W7GAK> Feel free to DM me for more information
Thank you Jon! I will let you know
does anybody have experience integrating algolia site search with HubSpot and if so how did it go?
if that jon character is not your cup of tea, let me know.  :jon-m:

How often does the Site Search results update? I'm trying to update all instances of "Agile Harbor" (old parent company) to "SkuVault, Inc" on our website and using site search keeps return pages that I've already updated. <@U6TBZ66FN>?
Can you send me an example?
The results are cached for a few minutes but should be updating right away
Sorry, I meant to send the web address. <https://www.skuvault.com/search>
So I won't need to wait hours or days, right?
No should be fast
Which search term should I be using to see the issue?
"Agile Harbor"

That's our old parent company, but it's no longer. We are just SkuVault, Inc now, so I need to replace all instances. I already updated the footer, but I'm still getting tons of pages where site search is giving me the old footer content.
This should be fixed soon
Give me a few minutes
Any suggestions for a free tool to crawl my site on demand would be helpful too. We have more pages than what the free version of Screaming Frog allows.
When did this change go into place?
This morning. Let me see if I can get an exact time of when I updated the footer.
Ok that would be great. There was an issue this morning with the dependency service so we may have missed the update
I am just reindexing your portal right now
I updated the footer almost an hour ago.
10:40, and it's 11:35 here.
Yea that might be the issue, fix is coming out < 5 minutes
Sweet! Thanks.
I may have discovered something. There are actually some pages based on a different footer that didn't get updated. So that may be what's going on too.
Ok want to take a look at the results again?
<https://www.skuvault.com/search?term=agile+harbor>
Looks like some pages still have agile harbor in the description
Perfect. Only two pages of results now. MUCH better. Thanks so much!
Like in the meta description? Does site search return results in the meta description?
I can see now that it does. Thanks!
does anybody know if you can create translated pages in the staging area… i found the option on the View Page Details screen but its throwing an error when i try to create the new translation

Is there some sort of Custom Module grader I can use as I review some custom modules my team made for the marketplace? I'm thinking something like HubSpot's Website Grader, but for custom modules.

I was just watching some of the recordings from Developer day and there were some best practices / do's and don'ts that were mentioned in a custom module presentation. As I'm looking at our modules, I want to make sure that we did our part well before they even hit the store. My main concern is the size of some of these modules in terms of just built in HTML, CSS, and JS and the potential load time that could be caused by unecessary styles and functionality (and how it was all coded).
sorry, no not at this time. though I could see them introducing a custom module grader as a tool to improve the quality of your custom modules for the marketplace.
if you’re worried about the size of the code,  there are a lot of things you can do, like always using {%--%} instead of {%%}
and if options are toggled using hubl that make things show/hide, those shown/hidden things should be behind if statements so the html isn’t rendered if it’s not going to be shown.
<@U7SL518D6> I'm curious, what is the difference between {%--%} vs {%%}?
<@U7SL518D6> Thanks for the tips! And yeah, I'm also curious about {%--%} vs {%%}

`{%-` strips whitespace in the html before `-%}` strips whitespace in html after.
This is especially useful if you use macros.

`{{- -}}` is also valid but there aren’t as many useful use-cases for this.

Basically if you view source on the page and you haven’t been using the minus symbols you’ll likely see large blank gaps around where your hubl code is

Using the minus symbol strips out that space meaning slightly smaller html file size meaning faster load time
also best practice - if you have multiple modules or templates that need the same css or JS, it should be in it’s own file and you link it to the module or template. this prevents duplicate code
Try to use as few HubDB queries as possible to pull off what you’re doing. It makes the page slightly faster and is way less taxing on HubSpot’s Servers
Rock on, thanks for the explanation, really appreciate it
So when you assign a featured image on a page, the `featured_image` variable in developer info under `content.featured_image` doesnt show any data.
<@U2H3TT8F2> can you link to a page where you're seeing this? I just tested it and am seeing the `content.featured_image` variable populated as expected.
DM'd you
:thumbsup:
